title: How to Get a Flying Mount and Soar the Skies in WoW

steps.title: Reach level 30 to learn the Expert Riding skill in Modern WoW.
steps.content: Reach level 30 to learn the Expert Riding skill in Modern WoW. All players automatically learn the Expert Riding skill when they reach level 30, which allows you to ride mounts in most areas in the game. However, some areas and other game modes have their own restrictions and requirements to learn flying. [1] X Research source Modern WoW is also sometimes called “Retail” WoW. [2] X Research source To fly in Zereth Mortis, you need to complete the achievement "Unlocking the Secrets", which is a meta-achievement containing 6 other achievements. [3] X Research source To fly in Battle for Azeroth (Legion) zones, you need the Broken Isles Pathfinder, Part Two achievement. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Reach level 60 to fly in WoW Classic.
steps.content: Reach level 60 to fly in WoW Classic. Once you reach level 60, visit Bralla Cloudwing in Stormwind or Maztha in Orgrimmar, and pay 250 gold to learn Expert Riding or Flight Master’s License. [5] X Research source In Wow Classic, Expert Riding allows you to fly in most areas. The Flight Master’s License allows you to fly in Kalimdor, Eastern Kingdoms, and Deepholm. [6] X Research source When you reach level 68 in WoW classic, you can purchase Cold Weather Flying for 500 gold, which allows you to fly in Northrend. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Purchase a flying mount.
steps.content: Purchase a flying mount. The cheapest mounts cost 50 gold. If you are in the Alliance, you can purchase a Gryphon from Tannec Stonebeak. [8] X Research source If you are in the Horde, visit Orgrimmar and purchase a Windrider from Drakma. [9] X Research source WoW Classic: Alliance players purchase a Gryphon from Grunda Bronzewing. Horde players purchase a Windrider from Bana Wildmane. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Collections journal and click on the mount you want to ride.
steps.content: Open the Collections journal and click on the mount you want to ride. Open up the Collections Journal (or press Shift-P) and click on the "Mounts" tab. There, you’ll find a list of mounts that are available to ride. Left-click on your flying mount, then click “Mount.” [11] X Research source

steps.title: Left-click to move forward and right-click to look around.
steps.content: Left-click to move forward and right-click to look around. Right-click on your mouse to aim your view. Hold down the left button on your mouse or the forward key on your keyboard to move forward. [12] X Research source To dismount, open the Collections journal and click “Dismount.” You can also click and drag your mount from the journal to your Action Bar. Click the icon once to mount and a second time to dismount. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Hold down the spacebar or look up and left-click to fly.
steps.content: Hold down the spacebar or look up and left-click to fly. Flying will allow you to cruise long distances or scout out an area. Here is how you can move around on your mount: [14] X Research source Press W to move forward. Press S to move back. Press A to turn left, and D to turn right. Press Q to strafe left, and E to strafe right. Press the spacebar to tilt up. Press X to tilt down.

steps.title: Reach level 80 to unlock Master Riding.
steps.content: Reach level 80 to unlock Master Riding. It will cost you 5,000 gold (or 4,000 if your reputation is Exalted), and give your mount 310% movement speed flight. [15] X Research source WoW Classic: The speed of your flying mount can also be increased with the Riding Crop trinket (10%), Mithril Spurs (4%), or the Carrot on a Stick trinket (3%). [16] X Research source

steps.title: Know what areas you can fly in and how.
steps.content: Know what areas you can fly in and how. Once you reach level 60, you will be able to fly almost anywhere since previous requirements have been removed. [17] X Research source The only places you cannot fly are: [18] X Research source Oribos, the Maw, and Korthia (Shadowlands) Argus (Legion) [19] X Research source Tanaan Jungle (intro to Warlords of Draenor), requires completion of the Draenor Pathfinder meta-achievement. [20] X Research source Isle of Thunder and Timeless Isle (Pandaria), requires level 90 and costs 2,500 gold. [21] X Research source The Molten Front (near Firelands) Tol Barad (PvP area introduced in Cataclysm) The Darkmoon Faire and Darkmoon Island Exodar, Azuremyst Isle, Wandering Isle, and Bloodmyst Isle Silvermoon, Eversong Woods, and Ghostlands Most instanced content (like scenarios, dungeons, raids, battlegrounds, and arenas). [22] X Research source

steps.title: Purchase the Expert Riding skill.
steps.content: Purchase the Expert Riding skill. This will cost 250 gold and will let you fly at 150% movement speed. [23] X Research source If you reach Exalted reputation with your faction, you can purchase the skill for 200 gold. [24] X Research source

steps.title: Know the limitations of your flying travel form.
steps.content: Know the limitations of your flying travel form. While flying as a Druid comes with many benefits, such as increased movement speed and no threat generation, it also comes with some drawbacks as well. Here are a few things to keep in mind before using your travel form: [25] X Research source You cannot use it while fighting. You cannot use it indoors. You cannot use it while already in another form. You cannot use a flying form in Dragonflight. [26] X Research source It will not benefit from Mount Equipment or Guild Perks (which make your riding faster).

steps.title: Open your Spellbook and use Travel Form.
steps.content: Open your Spellbook and use Travel Form. Once you know Expert Riding, your Travel Form will automatically shift you into a flying form, like a raven. [27] X Research source Increase your flying speed by 310% when you buy Master Riding at level 80. [28] X Research source

steps.title: Complete the Covenant storyline to quickly reach Renown 45.
steps.content: Complete the Covenant storyline to quickly reach Renown 45. Completing the Covenant storyline will definitely give you renown, but if you're still short, try running dungeons, killing world bosses, and completing callings. When you complete your Covenant campaign in Chains of Dominion, you will also receive a Covenant-specific flying mount. [29] X Research source

steps.title: Complete The Last Sigil from the Chains of Domination campaign.
steps.content: Complete The Last Sigil from the Chains of Domination campaign. Once you finish The Last Sigil, you'll get an item in your bags called the "Memories of Sunless Skies" that will unlock Shadowlands flying on all the characters on your account. [30] X Research source You'll then be able to fly in Bastion, Maldraxxus, Ardenweald, and Revendreth. You cannot, however, fly from one zone to another since flying is not permitted in Korithia, Obrios, and The Maw. [31] X Research source
